item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Passport Photos (644 points | 81 comments)
2. The English Paradox: Four Decades of Life and Language in Japan (44 points | 22 comments)
3. Guy gives a negative review to Battlezone after playing 8k hours; He's right (162 points | 55 comments)
4. Trudeau government bans TikTok from operating in Canada (523 points | 284 comments)
5. A rudimentary quantum network link between Dutch cities (12 points | 3 comments)
6. Visualizing binary files with ImHex's DSL, the "pattern language" (74 points | 5 comments)
7. Private Cloud Compute Security Guide (316 points | 137 comments)
8. 131M American Buildings (124 points | 27 comments)
9. Show HN: Hacker News frontpage as a print newspaper that you can personalize (298 points | 80 comments)
10. Nvidia Rides AI Wave to Pass Apple as Largest Company (26 points | 1 comment)
11. Creating Runtime and Application Images with JLink (10 points | 1 comment)
12. Show HN: SuperSplat – open-source 3D Gaussian Splat Editor (214 points | 44 comments)
13. Launch HN: Midship (YC S24) – Turn PDFs, docs, and images into usable data (68 points | 41 comments)
14. One year, 41M digits: How Luke Durant found the largest known prime number (41 points | 18 comments)
15. Physicists spot quantum tornadoes twirling in a 'supersolid' (67 points | 3 comments)
16. Australia proposes ban on social media for those under 16 (117 points | 73 comments)
17. The evolutionary mystery of the German cockroach (35 points | 4 comments)
18. Forget CDK and AWS's insane costs. Pulumi and DigitalOcean to the rescue (115 points | 63 comments)
19. Monorepo – Our Experience (148 points | 151 comments)
20. The deep learning boom caught almost everyone by surprise (257 points | 156 comments)
21. Show HN: Aide, an open-source AI native IDE (163 points | 126 comments)
22. Ping Rate Clock (11 points | discuss)
23. Model Predictive Control in the Browser with WebAssembly (104 points | 13 comments)
24. Hacking cars in JavaScript (Replay attacks in the browser with the HackRF) (59 points | 1 comment)
25. Kernel optimization with BOLT (binary optimization and layout tool) (152 points | 19 comments)
26. Switch 2 will be backwards compatible with Switch (300 points | 183 comments)
27. Exposure to phthalate compromises brain function in adult vertebrates (104 points | 38 comments)
28. 3D Rotation Design (112 points | 28 comments)
29. WebSockets cost us $1M on our AWS bill (286 points | 166 comments)
30. Useful built-in macOS command-line utilities (716 points | 202 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 7, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
